item.title: Markoff $m$-triples with $k$-Fibonacci components
item.description: arXiv:2409.13885v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We classify all solution triples with $k$-Fibonacci components to the equation $x^2+y^2+z^2=3xyz+m,$ where $m$ is a positive integer and $k\geq 2$. As a result, for $m=8$, we have the Markoff triples with Pell components $(F_2(2), F_2(2n), F_2(2n+2))$, for $n\geq 1$. For all other $m$ there exists at most one such ordered triple, except when $k=3,$ $a$ is odd, $b$ is even and $b\geq a+3$, where $(F_3(a),F_3(b),F_3(a+b))$ and $(F_3(a+1),F_3(b-1),F_3(a+b))$ share the same $m$.
item.dc:creator: D. Alfaya, L. A. Calvo, A. Mart\'inez de Guinea, J. Rodrigo, A. Srinivasan

item.title: Convolutions of second order sequences: A direct approach
item.description: arXiv:2409.14358v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Using a direct algebraic approach we derive convolution identities for second order sequences, hereby distinguishing between sequences obeying the same or different recurrence relations. We also state a general convolution for Horadam sequences. Convolutions for Chebyshev polynomials will also be stated.
item.dc:creator: Kunle Adegoke, Segun Olofin Akerele, Robert Frontczak

item.title: Existence of limit of multivariable function
item.description: arXiv:2403.19673v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This article provides several theorems regarding the existence of limit for multivariable function, among which Theorem 1 and Theorem 3 relax the requirement for sequence of Heine's definition of limit. These results address the question of which paths need to be considered to determine the existence of limit for multivariable function.
item.dc:creator: Ming Yang

item.title: Representations of Real Numbers by Alternating Perron Series and Their Geometry
item.description: arXiv:2408.01465v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We consider the representation of real numbers by alternating Perron series ($P^-$-representation), which is a generalization of representations of real numbers by Ostrogradsky-Sierpi\'nski-Pierce series (Pierce series), alternating Sylvester series (second Ostrogradsky series), alternating L\"{u}roth series, etc. Namely, we prove the basic topological and metric properties of $P^-$-representation and find the relationship between $P$-representation and $P^-$-representation in some measure theory problems.
item.dc:creator: Mykola Moroz
